revised_title: Comparative Biology of Plant Reproductive Traits: Ecological Correlates and Phylogenetic Constraints
tldr: This article explores the comparative biology of pollination and mating in flowering plants, focusing on floral allocation strategies, mating systems, and life history. The authors use various comparative methods to analyze reproductive traits and discuss the potential benefits of well-resolved phylogenies for understanding plant reproductive adaptations. They emphasize the importance of considering both ecological and evolutionary factors in studying plant reproduction.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Ecology and Evolution
